name: Code Quality Rubric
description: Evaluates code for readability, correctness, error handling, and documentation

criteria.name: Correctness
criteria.description: Does the code correctly solve the problem? Are there bugs or logical errors?
indicators: Logic is sound and produces correct results

criteria.name: Readability
criteria.description: Is the code easy to understand? Are naming and structure clear?
indicators: Variable and function names are descriptive
Code structure is logical and organized

criteria.name: Error Handling
criteria.description: Does the code handle errors gracefully? Are edge cases considered?
indicators: Edge cases (empty lists, null values, etc.) are addressed

criteria.name: Documentation
criteria.description: Is the code well-documented? Are docstrings and comments present where needed?
indicators: Parameters and return values are documented
